Definition at line 44 of file GrPolygonUVAtlas.cpp.

bool GrPolygonUVAtlas::Insert ( URect &  rect,
unsigned int  width,
unsigned  height 
)

can we even fit in this region?

if we don't have any children on this node, then there is no leaf rectangle. That means we can place the rectangle here.

if _child1 is NULL, then both children must be NULL.

calculate the leaf rectangle.

now build our children using the remaining two rectangles. note that we choose an optimal rectangular break using the width > height check. This tries to avoid any really long and thin strips.

return the leaf rectangle to the user.

return true since we found a home for our node.

if we got here, then we have children already. In this case, simply recurse.

if we couldn't insert in any children, then we should simply return false to indicate failure.
